properties.areaDesc: Lower Snake River Plain; Eastern Magic Valley; Beaverhead/Lemhi Highlands; Southern Hills/Albion Mountains; Bear Lake Valley; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Franklin/Eastern Oneida Region; Raft River Region; Arco/Mud Lake Desert; Upper Snake River Plain; Shoshone/Lava Beds
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 10 at 3:49AM MST until January 11 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Pocatello ID
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow, moderate to heavy at times, with blowing and
drifting snow expected. Total accumulations for the Snake Plain
and Magic Valley of 2 to 6 inches with higher amounts possible
along the benches. For the South Hills, Albion Mountains and the
rest of the southeast highlands highlands, 2 to 6 inches in the
valleys and up to 12 inches in the mountains. For the Beaverhead
and Lemhi Highlands, 2 to 7 inches.

* WHERE...Shoshone, Carey, Mud Lake, INL, Craters of the Moon,
Idaho Falls, Rexburg, St. Anthony, Pocatello, Blackfoot,
American Falls, Fort Hall, Burley, Heyburn, Oakley, Albion,
Almo, Malta, Holbrook, Inkom, McCammon, Downey, Lava Hot
Springs, Malad, Preston, Montpelier, Georgetown, Dubois,
Spencer, Edie School, and Small.

* WHEN...Friday evening through Saturday evening.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The combination of snow and wind will
create blowing and drifting conditions, impacting travel
especially in more exposed areas.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING
